dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIInspireGroundStation

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStation
        • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIInspireGroundStation

  • public class DJIInspireGroundStation
extends DJIGroundStation

    DJIInspireGroundStation

    Extending the DJIGroundStation, the DJIInspireGroundStation is designed for Inspire & Phantom3.

    Before you use the API of GroundStation, you should make sure that you have the SDK-LEVEL-2 key so that the authority would allow you to invoke the API.

    DJIGroundStation class would provide a series of operations for controlling the drone. It could satisfy your requirement of manually controlling the drone by app, seting up a cruise, investigating the place which you are interested in and follow you to capture your actions.

    For further understanding the API of ground station, we provide a guideline for operating.

    Step1 :openGroundStation() for opening the ground station so that the connection between app and drone could be set up.
    Step2 :uploadGroundStationTask() for uploading the tasks which the customers require to do.
    Step3 :startGroundStationTask() to send a signal for starting the tasks.
    Step4 :pauseGroundStationTask() for pausing tasks from the ground station. All of the message will be saved and reload if the resumeGroundStationTask() is invoked.
    Step5 :resumeGroundStationTask() for resuming tasks.
    Step6 :closeGroundStationTask() for terminating the tasks list.

    Between Step4 and Step5, the developers could update the task list. However, the startWaypointIndex should be set up correctly. In addition, if the developer want to check out the task list in the drone, the function downloadGroundStationTask() should be invoked after step3, which means the ground station tasks could be downloaded after the ground station task begins.



    What's more, the setJoystick function require the life cycle logically correct. There is a tutorial for constructing the life cycle.

    private OnScreenJoystick mScreenJoystick;
    private McuUpdateStateCallBack mMcuUpdateStateCallBack;
    private GroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack;

    protected void onCreat(){
      //other parameters
      mScreenJoystick.setJoystickListener();
      new Thread(){
        public void run(){
          DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation(). setAircraftJoystick();
       &emsp}
      }
      mMcuUpdateStateCallBack = new();
      mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack = new();
    }

    protected void onResume(){
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().startUpdateTimer();
      DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation().startUpdateTimer();
    }

    protected void onPause(){
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().stopUpdateTimer();
      DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation().stopUpdateTimer();
    }

    Different from Phantom 2 Vision Plus, Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 support two additional functions, named as Hot Point Navigation and Follow me.

    Hot Point is a function for investigating a place which you are interest in. The actions could be customer defined, which means you could determine the speed, radius, the head, and even whether the direction is clockwise or anti-clockwise. The navigation mode of hot point could follow the moving direction, forward the hot point, backward the hot point and remote controlling. For further understanding, you could get more information from the APIs with HotPoint postfix. Also, Follow Me is a function for allowing the drone to follow your movement. However, the follow me requires the target sending the GPS data to the drone to make sure the drone could correctly locate the target and then follow it. For further understanding, you could get more information from the APIs with FollowMe postfix.
    Version:
    V2.1.0
    Author:
    : DJI Software

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int interval)
        Start updating timer and set the interval between each update. The timer will request the information of ground station execution status. Once SDK receives information from flight control, SDK　will invoke a callback function. This callback function could be set up by setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack.
        Please note that the interval could not be lower than 100ms.
        Overrides:
        startUpdateTimer in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        interval - Timer run interval
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation.startUpdateTimer(int), setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack)

      • openGroundStation

        public void openGroundStation(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Open ground station.
        Before you get start to use ground station functions,please make sure that you have already open ground station.

        Use API Flight Control Mode:
        The waypoint mission and some other functions in SDK requires the autopilot entering API Flight Control mode, which is enabled by putting the mode selection bar to F position. Only in this mode does the autopilot response to control commands sent from the mobile application. This design makes sure that the remote controller is the emergency safety switch. Anytime when the user makes the mode selection bar leave F position, the API control mode is turned off. If the mode selection bar is already at F position when the autopilot is powed on, then user must switch back and forth to enable API control mode. This mechanism can prevent the autopilot from executing instructions sent from autonomous mobile application.
        Overrides:
        openGroundStation in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The ground station execute callBack which will return the executed result of the execution.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of ground station, such as GS_Result_Successed.
        Note: if you get the result GS_Result_Rc_Control_Mode_Error(0x06), you should put the remote controller's mode selection bar to F position.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • closeGroundStation

        public void closeGroundStation(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Close ground station. If any of ground stations will not be used any longer, it's a good habit to close ground station so that there will not be any abnormal error.
        Overrides:
        closeGroundStation in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The ground station execute callBack which will return the executed result of execution.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of ground station, such as GS_Result_Failed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • uploadGroundStationTask

        public void uploadGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationTask task,
                                    DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Upload ground station task. This function will upload the ground station tasks to the aircraft. Once the aircraft receives the tasks, it will replace the original tasks with the new one that app sends to aircraft.
        Please remember if you upload the tasks, only the original list of tasks in aircraft would be updated and none of them would be executed until you invoke startGroundStationTask().The maximum number of waypoint list is 99.
        Overrides:
        uploadGroundStationTask in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        task - The ground station task
        mCallBack - The ground station execute callBack which will return the executed result of execution.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of ground station, such as GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

        public void startGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationTakeOffCallBack mCallBack)

        Overrides:
        startGroundStationTask in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:

        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationTakeOffResult

      • cancelGroundStationTask

        public void cancelGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationTakeOffCallBack mCallBack)
        This function is designed for canceling the way point mission. For Inspire 1 & Phantom 3 The content of ground station has been extended and it consists of way point mission (named as groundstation for P2V+ and for the consideration of compatibility, we still use groundstation as the representation of way point mission ), hot point navigation, follow me navigation and joystick. These four functions are mutual exclusion. For Inspire 1 and Phantom 3, we recommend that using the cancelGroundStationTask() would be a better way to way to shut down way point mission.
        Overrides:
        cancelGroundStationTask in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The ground station take off callBack which will return the executed result of take off execution.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationTakeOffResult result) - the result will reflect the status of taking off, such as GS_Takeoff_Began.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationHoverResult

      • pauseGroundStationTask

        public void pauseGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationHoverCallBack mCallBack)

        public void goHome(DJIGroundStationGoHomeCallBack mCallBack)
